Hearing.intro: <info>[House Hearing, 115 Congress]</info> <info>[From the U.S. Government Publishing Office]</info> <Doc-title>BUSINESS MEETING: MARKUP OF COMMITTEE RESOLUTION 115-19</Doc-title> <option>======================================================================= HEARING BEFORE THE </option> <committee_name>COMMITTEE ON HOUSE</committee_name> <option> ADMINISTRATION HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES ONE HUNDRED FIFTEENTH CONGRESS SECOND SESSION __________ JUNE 26, 2018 __________ Printed for the use of the Committee on House Administration [GRAPHIC NOT AVAILABLE IN TIFF FORMAT] Available on the Internet: https://www.govinfo.gov/committee/house-administration __________ U.S. GOVERNMENT PUBLISHING OFFICE 33-061 WASHINGTON : 2018 ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- For sale by the Superintendent of Documents, U.S. Government Publishing Office, http://bookstore.gpo.gov. For more information, contact the GPO Customer Contact Center, U.S. Government Publishing Office. Phone 202-512-1800, or 866-512-1800 (toll-free). E-mail, gpo@custhelp.com. Committee on House Administration GREGG HARPER, Mississippi, Chairman RODNEY DAVIS, Illinois, Vice ROBERT A. BRADY, Pennsylvania, Chairman Ranking Member BARBARA COMSTOCK, Virginia ZOE LOFGREN, California MARK WALKER, North Carolina JAMIE RASKIN, Maryland ADRIAN SMITH, Nebraska BARRY LOUDERMILK, Georgia </option> <Doc-title>BUSINESS MEETING: MARKUP OF COMMITTEE RESOLUTION 115-19</Doc-title> <paragraph paraId="1" speaker="">The Committee met, pursuant to call, at 11:06 a.m., in Room 1310, Longworth House Office Building, Hon. Gregg Harper [Chairman of the Committee] presiding.</paragraph> <hearing-info paraId="2" speaker="">Present: Representatives Harper, Davis, Walker, Smith, Loudermilk, and Brady.</hearing-info> <paragraph paraId="3" speaker=""> Staff Present: Sean Moran, Staff Director; Kim Betz, Deputy Staff Director/Policy and Oversight; Steven Wall, Deputy General Counsel; Dan Jarrell, Legislative Clerk; Amanda Anger, Professional Staff Member; Matt Field, Director of Oversight; Erin McCracken, Communications Director; Jamie Fleet, Minority Staff Director; Khalil Abboud, Minority Deputy Staff Director; and Eddie Flaherty, Minority Chief Clerk. </paragraph> <paragraph paraId="3" speaker=""> The Chairman. I now call to order the Committee on House </paragraph> <paragraph paraId="4" speaker="">Staff Present: Sean Moran, Staff Director; Kim Betz, Deputy Staff Director/Policy and Oversight; Steven Wall, Deputy General Counsel; Dan Jarrell, Legislative Clerk; Amanda Anger, Professional Staff Member; Matt Field, Director of Oversight; Erin McCracken, Communications Director; Jamie Fleet, Minority Staff Director; Khalil Abboud, Minority Deputy Staff Director; and Eddie Flaherty, Minority Chief Clerk. Administration for today's Committee meeting. A quorum is present, so we may proceed.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="5" speaker="">The meeting record will remain open for 5 legislative days so that Members may submit any materials that they wish to be included therein.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="6" speaker="">There is one item on our docket today, Committee Resolution 115-19, a resolution to disburse $200,000 from the Committee's Reserve Fund to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs. This disbursement is in response to a request the Committee received from the Chairman and Ranking Member of the House Committee on Veterans' Affairs.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="7" speaker="">The disbursement will provide resources for the Committee on Veterans' Affairs to establish a new Technology Modernization Subcommittee. This new subcommittee will focus its oversight efforts on the VA's $15.8 billion Electronic Health Record Modernization Program, by far the largest electronic health record transition ever attempted as well as one of the Federal Government's biggest IT projects.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="8" speaker=""> I would now like to recognize my colleague and the Committee's Ranking Member, Mr. Brady, for the purpose of providing an opening statement. </paragraph> <speaker>Mr. Brady</speaker> <paragraph paraId="9" speaker="Mr. Brady">Thank you, Mr. Chairman.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="10" speaker="Mr. Brady">Mr. Chairman, I support the funding request for the Veterans' Committee. And I have received assurances from the Ranking Member that he will have access to one-third of the funds, consistent with their tradition of how money is spent on a committee--for a committee is handled.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="11" speaker="Mr. Brady">With that assurance, I support the request and urge my colleagues to do the same.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="12" speaker="Mr. Brady"> And I yield back. </paragraph> <speaker>The Chairman. The gentleman yields back</speaker> <paragraph paraId="13" speaker="The Chairman. The gentleman yields back"/> <paragraph paraId="14" speaker="The Chairman. The gentleman yields back">Does any other Member wish to be recognized for the purpose of an opening statement?</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="15" speaker="The Chairman. The gentleman yields back">I now call up and lay before the Committee Committee Resolution 115-19. Without objection, the first reading is dispensed with, and the resolution is considered read and open for amendment.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="16" speaker="The Chairman. The gentleman yields back">[The information follows:]</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="17" speaker="The Chairman. The gentleman yields back"> [[GRAPHIC NOT AVAILABLE IN TIFF FORMAT] </paragraph> <paragraph paraId="17" speaker="The Chairman. The gentleman yields back"> The Chairman. Would any Member like to make a statement or </paragraph> <paragraph paraId="18" speaker="The Chairman. The gentleman yields back">[[GRAPHIC NOT AVAILABLE IN TIFF FORMAT] offer an amendment?</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="19" speaker="The Chairman. The gentleman yields back">Seeing none, I move the Committee adopt Committee Resolution 115-19.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="20" speaker="The Chairman. The gentleman yields back">The question is on the motion.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="21" speaker="The Chairman. The gentleman yields back">All those in favor, signify by saying aye.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="22" speaker="The Chairman. The gentleman yields back">All those opposed, signify by saying nay.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="23" speaker="The Chairman. The gentleman yields back">In the opinion of the Chair, the ayes have it, and the motion is agreed to.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="24" speaker="The Chairman. The gentleman yields back">Without objection, the motion to reconsider is laid upon the table.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="25" speaker="The Chairman. The gentleman yields back">Does any Member wish to submit supplemental or minority views?</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="26" speaker="The Chairman. The gentleman yields back">Seeing none, for all the matters considered here today, I would ask unanimous consent that the staff be authorized to make technical and conforming changes if necessary.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="27" speaker="The Chairman. The gentleman yields back">Without objection, so ordered.</paragraph> <paragraph paraId="28" speaker="The Chairman. The gentleman yields back">That concludes today's markup. Without objection, the markup is adjourned.</paragraph>
